brief: All shapes are constructed by connecting a series of vertices.
name: vertex()
description:
All shapes are constructed by connecting a series of vertices. vertex() is used to specify the vertex coordinates for points, lines, triangles, quads, and polygons. It is used exclusively within the beginShape() and endShape() functions.

Drawing a vertex in 3D using the z parameter requires the P3D parameter in combination with size, as shown in the above example.

This function is also used to map a texture onto geometry. The texture() function declares the texture to apply to the geometry and the u and v coordinates set define the mapping of this texture to the form. By default, the coordinates used for u and v are specified in relation to the image's size in pixels, but this relation can be changed with textureMode().

parameters.name: graphics
parameters.description: any object of the type PGraphics

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: vertex parameters, as a float array of length VERTEX_FIELD_COUNT

parameters.name: u
parameters.description: horizontal coordinate for the texture mapping

parameters.name: v
parameters.description: vertical coordinate for the texture mapping
